definition: if I (you, she, he...) had known it would come to this, I (you, she, he...) would not have acted thus (idiom)/to regret vainly one's past behavior
pinyin: zao3 zhi1 jin1 ri4 he2 bi4 dang1 chu1

sentences.english: Aunt says that a process, I do not planted it , and let it suck in the.
sentences.chinese: 姨姨则说，早知如此，我就不栽它，任它吸地了。

sentences.english: If I had only known, I would have been a locksmith.
sentences.chinese: 早知如此，我宁愿做个锁匠。

sentences.english: I should, ve ordered glutinous rice chicken.
If I had known he was ill, I would not have asked him to come.
sentences.chinese: 早知他有病，我就不会叫他来了。

sentences.english: If I had known it, I wouldn't have told her.
sentences.chinese: 早知如此，我就不告诉她了。

sentences.english: I knew her father for the simplest, hardest working man that ever drew the breath of life.
sentences.chinese: 我早知她的父亲是一个世上最简朴最努力工作的人。

sentences.english: I alert each other's problems and where to seize the final defeat of the other side.
sentences.chinese: 我早知对方的毛病在哪并抓住了，最后把对方打败了。

sentences.english: If I'd known then what was going to happen， I wouldn't have done as I did.
The weather was so bad we might as well have stayed at home.
sentences.chinese: 天气太坏了，早知如此，我们倒不如呆在家里的好。

sentences.english: I had known it, I would have joined it.
Besides, you must know some day, -- as well now as later.
sentences.chinese: 另外，有一天你还得知道，早知晚知都一样。

If I had known it, I would not have joined in to.
sentences.chinese: 早知如此，我就不参加了。
